result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karyn J. Ward

defendant.name: Ward, Karyn J.
defendant.address: Taycheedah Correctional Institute  #638764, 751 County Road K, Fond du Lac, WI 54937

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Karyn J. Ward
Current: Taycheedah Correctional Institute  #638764, 751 County Road K, Fond du Lac, WI 54937 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 1152 5th St E, Altoona, WI 54720
of Sentencing Hearing held on June 27, 2022

(Cases 22CF150, 22CF414 are called at 1:03 PM) Defendant Karyn J. Ward in court, in custody.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Karyn J. Ward. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Tina Schoengarth appears by video. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Pre-Sentence Investigation and amended Pre-Sentence Investigation. Defense indicates there was no amendment- State indicates the additional information is page 6. 
Off the record for discussion regarding amended Pre-Sentence Investigation. (1:04 PM- 1:07 PM) 
Defense is ready to proceed. Defense indicates no additions or corrections to the Pre-Sentence Investigation or amended Pre-Sentence Investigation. Victim/Witness statute complied with. State makes sentence recommendation and argument.  Defense makes sentence recommendation and argument. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court orders 96 months of Initial Confinement and 48 months of Extended Supervision with 8 days credit. 
Court orders conditions of Extended Supervision: Restitution totaling $1,582.86 ($800 to C.H. and $782.86 to Charter Bank) plus the 10% surcharge; No contact with R.H., G.G., N.K., M.L., (victim) C.H. or C.H.'s residence, D.Z., Charter Bank; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs.  
Court finds the Defendant eligible for any prison programming by statute.

(Cases 22CF150, 22CF414 are called at 10:37 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Karyn J. Ward appeared by video, in custody from Dunn County Jail.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Karyn J. Ward.  District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises the Defendant of charges in 22CF414. Defense indicates there is an agreement in which the State is going to request a Pre-Sentence Investigation. Defendant objects. Discussion held. Defendant agrees to continue knowing the Court will order a Pre-Sentence Investigation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF150 Count 3- Possession of Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>10-50g) as Second or Subsequent Offense and as Repeater. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 22CF414. 
Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. Sentencing Hearing: 06/27/2022 at 1:00 PM.
Sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
